reviews.text:
This very Starbucks is an old western style house located on the slope side which lead up to the foreigners houses area.
The service is great and you should have a coffee here in this old house instead of paying entrance fees to the houses on the upper hill side.
The house should be over 100 years old and it's a two stories building.

Is the most beautiful shop to be ranked As disciples need to experience the atmosphere here. The place is huge because it is the whole house. A lot of seats Beautiful, both in the daytime and at night. A very classic class for here.
You may have the coffee in such a amazing building, feel different. But you better find a day or non peak hour. There is alway full of people.

This Starbucks is probably the coolest one I have traveled to in the world. I love to grab a seat in one of the second floor rooms and relax with a book and a coffee. Sadly seating can be hard to come by later during the day as this location does draw attention and a crowd from people traveling to and from the Kitano neighborhood in Japan. The customer service is great and the menu has enough English for travelers to get by.

One of the top Starbucks in Japan, in terms of decorations, architecture and designs. This is located within the stretch of nice buildings which are more European in style. Kobe is one of the earliest cities within Japan that opened up to foreign influences and you can see that in terms of cuisine available, buildings and culture. 

Back to starbucks, this is a two storeys building, with the settings of European influences. The services and coffees are typical of Starbucks. People are friendly and standard English to order Starbucks are easily understood.
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.

Excellent place to sit around and watch the shows here during yearly events. Visited this place last year. People come here to enjoy the evenings. The tower will be lit during the nights and it was most beautiful to watch around. The nearby port was maintained very near and clean. I had spend my time here watching fun.

Awesome View! Kobe port tower gives an breathtaking view of Kobe city and the surrounding mountains it's good to be there just before dusk as you can see the day time view and also the night view as it gradually gets dark outside. Even the adjacent marine museum is a place worth visiting.

A good place for a panoramic view of the city of kobe. Located within the port will also gives one proximity to the waterfront shopping and f&b outlets. Tourists are recommended to go up the tower such that it gives one the various location of the city attractions.

Loved the observation deck. Super-friendly staffs. Lately they were giving free mini-photograph as a souvenir. Last 2018, they don't have this service. I always buy medal keychain here as a souvenir also.

Amazing watch out. Can see the whole Osaka Bay (Kobe) when the weather is good. Nearby are so many other attractions, restaurants and shopping malls. Transportation is well designed and convenience. Must go check point in Kobe.

Simply a wonderful museum . It is a beautiful museum  The museum is 3 levels starting at the the top level and work your way down. It is handicapped accessible and has handicapped bathroom facilities Tells a great story of carpentry in Japan.  Great selection of tools, wood and types of joinery used in Japanese carpentry.  The museum has a hands on section for adults and children and the museum is free. If enjoy the art of design and carpentry this is certainly a museum to visit if you are in Kobe.

Lovely, modern museum with special exhibits on a seasonal basis. Entry fee is reasonable and English, Korean and Chinese audio guide are available for free. 

The museum also runs several workshops throughout the day, advance booking is sometimes required but times should definitely be checked before hand if interested.

Amazing to learn about the various joints used instead of nails. Had fun trying to assemble or take apart the various types of joints. There is a pleasant scent of wood and touching some of them added another dimension to the experience. An eye opener into traditional Japanese architecture. The building itself is a piece of art!

Looooove! Incredible museum showcasing the history, tools, and technique behind traditional Japanese woodworking. Free audio guide. Affordable workshops. Beautiful building and grounds. You can definitely spend an entire afternoon here!
Woodwork workshop was an awesome experience with the elderly carpenter volunteers. The exhibits were informative and the architecture and design was amazing

The gardens were beautiful and the ropeway ride was very smooth. The restaurant at the top station was amazing! They have a set price and menu, but the food was some of the best I've had so far in Japan. The price wasn't too bad either, 2380 yen for an adult. It comes with a main meal, an appetizer buffet and an herbal tea. I feel like I would have had to pay at least triple that for a similar experience back home. Highly recommend trying it!

Our goal really was to hike up Mount Maya, but tips and instructions to find the hiking paths up were too convoluted. After much frustration and more than an hour of searching, we were still unable to find the path to hike up. So instead, we admitted defeat and used the cable cars to ride up along the mountain, with the herb gardens in full view along the slopes. The views of the city and of the water were still breathtaking, but we felt like we didn’t work for it. =/

There is a place that offers gourmet hot dogs and ice cream at the top of the herb gardens, and while the view was nice, we were too cold to appreciate it for more than a few minutes. We did, however, find a hiking path down from the gardens, and it served as enough of a challenge to satisfy us. =) If you’re hiking down, there is a bathroom/modest rest stop on the way. Beware that there might not be any toilet paper, so come prepared!

There was an old shrine right before the waterfalls that was interesting to explore. It gave me an eerie feeling—coupled with the sun setting, we wanted to get to the bottom before nightfall. There are a couple of small shrines right at the waterfalls and then right after, there are long swathes of craggily steps you have maneuver before reaching the end.

Great sights, some eeriness, lots of frustration (I lost my phone right after this trip), but I recommend trying it at least once. If you’re too tired to hike, at the very least use the cable cars to see some amazing views.

Modeled after a cute European town, the Nunobiki Herb Garden is incredibly charming. There’s local beer, food, herbs and more! There’s also a great overlook where you can see our past Kobe City. It’s a lovely place to spend the afternoon!

A nice place to go when the weather is good.  Great date spot.  Awesome  view of Kobe and an interesting shop at the top with herbs and herb-related things. There is a snack bar and restaurant at the top and walk down into the park to the green house where there is another restaurant.  If you walk down through the entire garden you can catch a ropeway car down from the midway station.

I think not worth a visit as there’s really nothing much to see .. limited herd garden to know about herb, limited flower display and probably a great view to Kobe town as you take a ropeway to the mountain. Nice area to sit and relax but nothing spectacular.. I am surprised why they build a ropeway just to see this herb garden?

My favorite hangout place in Nagata - specially in the evenings. Lot of teenagers flock the place with soccer balls and skate boards. Large open space with the huge Gigantor 'the protector of Kobe' statue at the centre. 
also, there are plenty of food options around.

It's a nice place to visit if you are in the Kobe area. Only a few stations over by train. The statue is really cool, even the light posts have Gigantor on them. Many shops and restaurants in the vicinity as well. The area is a little dirty though, there was a lot of trash blowing around when I went there. I was a bit surprised considering how clean most of Japan is.
This is a iron man statue,it depicts the character tetsujin created by kobe born manga artist mitsuteru yokoyama.The statue is 18 meters tall..
A large symbol of the strengths of Kobe people who restored their city after the earthquake
Coming here too late around 19.30. It’s not crowded and can take many photos.

If you are interested in sake, it is a must do. I would strongly suggest you also go for the Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan brewery where you'll be able to taste amazing sake especially the unpasteurised one you can only taste in Japan. Make sure you call in advance (2-3 days) for a tour.
The museum does not require booking and is amazing in details.

Interesting sake museum with real old school sake making tools on display. There is a 10 minutes introduction video in Japanese and English. There are 2 kinds of wine to take at the end of the tour. Lots of yummy otsumami to taste at the gift shop. Very friendly usher personnel. Not very crowded on a Friday afternoon.
The museum is alright, learned a fair bit. However the two samples I had in the gift shop were thr best sake I'd personally ever had.

Went to this place earlier this year and was awesome! Great little museum and their shop is great with English speaking staff. Talked to one of the staff for 40 mins while trying sake and buying...a bit
Learn about how sake was made in the past. Good artifacts. Great sake at the end

The lemon sake was my favorite! I had a nice tour of the brewery and got the chance to talk to a great old guy about sake. he even took a picture with me. I left with two bottles of lemon sake to share with my friends in America. Thank you to all at the brewery for making me feel like family!

This is Hamafukuzuru sake brewery. They have a good sake tasting setup and the sake was very nice. There are five or six sake breweries in this part of Kobe. You can spend the day checking all of them out, tasting sake, and buying bottles to take home.
We only made it to three of the seven brewerys but this was the best. Large range to taste, everyone left with a few bottles.

Although I only stayed for a short while, I had a fantastic experience at this brewery. I stepped in about 30 minutes prior to their closing time, but they took their time in allowing me to sample nearly all of their different types of sake, both pasteurized and non-pasteurized. As I informed them that I would be bringing the sake back to the US, they suggested a pasteurized product and allowed me to try all of them. An older man (who I assume was the owner) came out while I was tasting and took out the special liquoers to give me a sample, as he assured me that Japanese women loved the lemon flavor. I had to pass on that as I had someone waiting at home, but it was delicious. 

I purchased a serving set as well and they packaged it up nicely when I informed them that it would be going back to the US (different employee than the ones who had served me before). Overall, a great experience and I wish I could have stayed longer. Also, a woman that was there offered to give me a ride back to the train station from the brewery. I love Japan.
Strongly recommended. They have an interesting Sake tasting program.
Fantastic Omakase!  Nice friendly chef

鮨大の煮穴子は世界一です。
何を食べても美味しいです。素敵な大将の味。
絶対行くべきお店ですね。
後悔しないうちに足をはこんでみてください。

Great Japanese beef cutlets and their homemade brown sauce is delicious . Their deep fried oysters are also seasonal only during winter . Price is fair and food is delicious . Lunch queue is sometimes long so be prepared to queue.
Mix fry teishoku (lunch) came with two massive fried prawns, a thick scallop, and a cutlet of minced meat with demi-glacé sauce all on a bed of shredded cabbage for JPY 1,100. Bam!
Great meat, very crispy & delicious sauce.

ONE OF THE BEST DISHES I’VE HAD IN JAPAN 

the Beef Katsu and omurice is a must order.
Oh man the food here is just awesome. The cutlet is so delicious, no wonder it's always lining up.

Since the day I first heard of Kobe beef, I knew I had to taste it from the source. The rating is not so much for how good the meal is, but the value for money you get. We went with the a5 quality sirloin, and indeed the meat was very good and tender like none other. But is it worth the price? Not for me. I've had comparable pieces of meat for 1/6 the price. Don't get me wrong, this was by a slight margin better, but I'll honestly never order it again. It's good to have on the bucket list though

The service we received here was exceptional.  From the moment we were led to our table, there were at least 3 - 4 different wait staff helping us, seating us, pouring water, taking our coats, etc....10/10

The meat, oh my.  Words can never do it justice.  Is it pricey? Absolutely.  Would I eat this everyday if I could? Probably not. 

But for the hour and a bit we were there seated in our private room with a chef cooking before us, everything felt worth it. 

Kobe beef is not for everyone because of how hyped it's been and yes, you are partially paying for that.  Some people might not even like the fat-to-meat ratio, and that's perfectly understandable too.  But damn, if you are a beef lover and have an opportunity, you must try A5 wagyu once in your life.

The steak is as expected, really tasty and buttery. The place looks really cute, and you get a nice full course meal (soup, salad, veggies, coffee or tea afterward). But two things made it not reach 5 stars. 1) the staff was a lot less welcoming than all other restaurants we've eaten at (been here for 2 weeks) and 2) the cost. We got one Kobe beef fillet and one wagyu sirloin, and each one glass of wine. Came out to about 30000yen. Definitely worth trying out if you're a foodie / really into steak, but be prepared for a steep price.

Even for an almost always vegetarian/vegan this was worth sinning. The Kobe Rib-eye was the most tender, mouth watering meat I have ever tasted. The chef’s recommendations were on point and although the price is high the quality is obvious. Reservation is needed (I suggest asking your hotel with this task, to avoid online booking fees).

Great staff and chef. Overall a wonderful dining experience. We select the cut(s) and they present them to us, before cooking them in front of us on the hot plate. We managed to get a reservation through our hotel concierge for lunch on the same day. Don’t expect Keens steakhouse type steak but if you like buttery fatty steak that melts in your mouth, this would be your jam
Nice staff, good drinks at cheap price and also food is cheap. Quality is ok.
Hard to communicate in English yet there is a machine you can order easily ^^
Good and cheap yakitori with a multi-language touchscreen ordering system.
早朝まで営業してる。 タッチパネルで注文するスタイル。 トイレも広くてきれかった。 トータルしていやすいお店。
鳥貴族はよく行きますが、こちらのお店は分煙されていて嬉しいです。服が臭くならないのでナイスです。
